title: Ticket #7484: oauth credentials are swept too quickly
description:
When a user has no jobs in the queue, the schedd may write a <username>.mark file in the SEC_CREDENTIAL_DIRECTORY, which tells the credd (I think?) that all of the user's tokens should be deleted. This causes a race between when a user obtains tokens and when the user submits a job that uses said tokens. If the schedd notices too quickly, writes the mark file, and the files are swept, the user is again prompted to obtain tokens.

Writing the mark file is fine, but I propose that we leave it up the credmon to decide when to sweep tokens. The credmon has a better idea of the expiration date of the tokens and can make intelligent cleanup decisions depending upon the mtimes of the mark file, the refresh and access token files, and the tokens' expirations.

2020-Jun-05 20:21:43 by bbockelm:
Just to note - this has bit CMS's attempts to use HTCondor to manage WLCG tokens. Please bump in priority.

2020-Jun-29 10:48:46 by zmiller:
I changed the code (to be released in 8.9.8) to look at config SEC_CREDENTIAL_SWEEP_DELAY and wait until the .mark file is at least that many seconds old before sweeping.

This of course stops HTCondor from deleting the creds out from under you, but there is still the open question: Should the CREDD or the CREDMON be responsible for deleting these? The answer shouldn't be "neither" but I guess it could be "both", which I think is what we have now.
